SENT.plain: The case of a 28-year-old female with an adult form of Niemann-Pick disease is described
The illness started at the age of 22 years
The characteristics actually established in the adult form of this lipidosis were discussed
Vision was impaired but there was no clinical evidence of importnat visual involvement
Neurologic and psychiatric examinations were always normal
The bone marrow contained foam cells
A cherry red spot was present in the macula
An uncommon association with Osler-Rendu-Weber disease was described

The patient maintained normal clinical and neurological conditions, that is, she continues to show an extraordinarily benign course with poor cerebral participation represented by a moderate localized cortical atrophy seen at the pneumoencephalogram
